title: Is bug abuse bannable?
body: I friend of mine dicovered a somewhat game breaking bug that he is going to abuse. I told him he could probably get banned or get his season rewards taken away if he does, but he doesn't believe me. Can anyone confirm this for me? I would perfer answers from someone who knows rather than is assuming like myself.

replies.body: It's called an "exploit".  It is bannable in 99% of the games I played.

I did recently read a post from a rioter stating that intentionally abusing bugs IS bannable. It is the same as cheating. If he knows it is a bug, then he can be banned. It was over a Sion bug that I saw it before.

Back in the day, you could abuse bugs with 0 consequences, I mean pro players did it all the time and nothing happened, but now a days, it's prob bannable, but it's like the rule to cheating, It's not cheating unless you're caught red handed intentionally abusing it.
what bug? dont worry i wont abuse it im just curious.

No one got banned from using the Hecarim double dash bug by smiting a minion he is charging at to reset the cooldown.  No one got banned for walking through walls with Leona.  As far as I know, people don't get banned for using bugs to their advantage as long as it isn't anything like the Xerath Q hitting everything in the game.

Yeah it was gamebreaking as fuck, like actually worse than the Xerath bug. Much.

Thank you for your response. If anyone has different thoughts mention it. Otherwise I am done.
